net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api

Interface DatatypeDetector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDatatypeDetector, DatatypeDetectorImpl

    @ComponentSpecification
public interface DatatypeDetector
    This is the interface to detect if some type is a Datatype.
    Since:
    4.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isDatatype(Class<?> type)
      This method determines if the given Class reflects an (immutable) Datatype .
      boolean isJavaStandardDatatype(Class<?> type)
      This method determines if the given Class reflects a Java standard Datatype provided by the JDK.

    • Method Detail

      • isDatatype

        boolean isDatatype(Class<?> type)
        This method determines if the given Class reflects an (immutable) Datatype . It will return true if the given value is a String, Boolean, Character, anything derived from Number, an Enum, an instance of Datatype, a Date (even though not immutable) or anything similar.
        Parameters:
        type - is the Class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given Class represents a Datatype, false otherwise.

      • isJavaStandardDatatype

        boolean isJavaStandardDatatype(Class<?> type)
        This method determines if the given Class reflects a Java standard Datatype provided by the JDK. This is any primitive type or any of Integer, Long, Double, Float, Byte, Short, Boolean, String, Character, BigInteger, BigDecimal, Date, Calendar, LocalDate, LocalTime, LocalDateTime, Instant, OffsetDateTime, OffsetTime, Duration, ZonedDateTime, YearMonth, MonthDay, Year, Period, ZoneOffset.
        Parameters:
        type - is the Class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given Class represents a Java standard Datatype, false otherwise.
        Since:
        6.0.0
